result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theartis Mitchell Milton

records.addlTxt: Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Theartis Mitchell Milton in court.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Theartis Mitchell Milton.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Attorney Galang was recently appointed by the public defenders office and  requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Theartis Mitchell Milton in court.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will schedule case for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Theartis Mitchell Milton in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Calendar Call held.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court finds good cause to toll preliminary hearing time limits.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Theartis Mitchell Milton not in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with V.H. and any location she occupies whether a residence, workplace, family gathering, etc.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES:
 Defendant Theartis Mitchell Milton in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Theartis Mitchell Milton in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Theartis Mitchell Milton
Current: 2615 Victory Lane, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 07-09-2022)
Prior: 4421 North 44th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
